title.en: Practical Project-based Training in Information Technology

description.en: The subject deals with practical project management (IT development project). The work takes place in groups and a real problem/project is used to achieve the learning outcomes.
description.et: Õppeaines käsitletakse praktilist projektijuhtimist (IT-alane arendusprojekt). Töö käib rühmades ning õpiväljundite saavutamiseks kasutatakse reaalset probleemi/projekti.

objectives.en: To develop practical skills in IT project preparation and to gain experience in project implementation.
objectives.et: Arendada IT projekti koostamise praktilist oskust ning omandada projekti elluviimise kogemus.

learning_outcomes.en: A student who completed an internship:
- participates in team work and fulfills assigned tasks;
learning_outcomes.et: - osaleb meeskonnatöös ning täidab talle määratud ülesandeid;

learning_outcomes.en: - manages the project and the project team;
- prepares IT project analysis and plans project sustainability;
learning_outcomes.et: - koostab IT projekti analüüsi ning planeerib projekti jätkusuutlikkust;

independent_work.et:
Stage 1: Requirements gathering and analysis:
1. Team up 3-4 students
2. Find projects from companies or pick from available projects to be implemented by the end of the Practice.
3. Submit Software Requirements Specification (SRS) well written: Presentation should contain: problem description, your methodology to address the problem, proposed solution, technology to be used and technical details to solve the problem.
For example:
Why the system will be built.
What problem it will solve or what opportunity is it meant to exploit?
Who is going to use the system? Use Case diagram
What type of system it will be (e.g. a Web API, a Web frontend, a mobile app, a desktop app?) and what will the system allow its users to achieve?
4. Project Plan: Who is going to do what responsible for what in team, create Work Breakdown Structure (WBS)
5. Each team will have to give presentation and demonstration of the Mockup/Wireframe/Prototype based on customer's requirements
6. Each team will have 20-30 min for presentation
7. Peer Review

Stage 2: design:
1. Submit Software Design Description (SDD) and class diagram well written: Presentation should contain: Subsystem decomposition, Software architecture, Hardware/Software mapping and data management.
2. Each team will have 20-30 min for presentation
3. Peer Review

Stage 3: impementation
1. Update project progress by using task management software, such as Asana. Create Project planning and scheduling, Time tracking, Tasks
2. Mid term demo: Each team will have 20-30 min for presentation
3. Peer Review

Stage 4: Testing
1. Test the functionality in the application covers all core use cases. The pro

report 20%
practical assignment 30%
final oral assessment 30%
test 20%

grade_evaluation.et:
1. Proposal Submission
2. Proposal Defense Presentation
3. Submit Report and Project Plan
4. Mockup, Wireframe, Prototype Online presentation
5. Online mid term demo
6. Final Technical Report Submission
7. Online final Demo
8. Peer Review
9. Customer Feedback

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

weeks.et: Stage 1: Requirements gathering and analysis Stage 2: Design Stage  Stage 3: implementation Stage 4: implementation
